assemblyInfo.assemblyMethod: FALCON v. DNANexus 1.9.0; FALCON-Unzip v. DNANexus 1.0.6; purge_haplotigs v. v1.0.3+ 1.Nov.2018; longranger align v. 2.2.2; freebayes Illumina polishing v. 1.3.1; gEVAL manual curation v. 2019-08-13; VGP assembly pipeline individual v. 1.5

bioprojects.title: Tauraco erythrolophus (Red-crested Turaco) genome, bTauEry1, alternate haplotype

description.comment: The Red-crested Turaco (Tauraco erythrolophus) is endemic to western Angola to Congo, Africa, and is the National bird of Angola. It has deep barking call that has been described to sound like a jungle monkey. It is named after its very colorful red crested feathers on its head. This sample was collected by Mads Bertelsen from a female that lived at the Copenhagen Zoo in Denmark and was used to generate a chromosome level reference assembly as part of the G10K-VGP and B10K Projects.
description.title: Animal sample from Tauraco erythrolophus

sampleIds.label: Sample name
sampleIds.value: Red-crested Turaco sample for G10K-VGP reference genome

assemblyInfo.comments: This assembly represents the alternate haplotype of the diploid genome Tauraco erythrolophus. The principal haplotype sequences are in WGS project WOXW00000000
assemblyInfo.sequencingTech: PacBio Sequel I CLR; Illumina NovaSeq; Arima Genomics Hi-C; Bionano Genomics DLS
